channel.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
channel.description:
I'm new here and this is my first post on the Drafts community forum.
Drafts has a rich and extensive documentation on it's functionality and various use-cases, including integration of x-callback-url.
The official x-callback-url website introduced a list of (third-party) Apps that support the specification.
Throughout the years, several attempts have been made by members of the community to update / document the list of Apps.
I.e One Tap Less_https://onetapless.com/library AppTalk_https://app-talk.com/ Opener_https://github.com/timonus/OpenerManifest
I've noticed that it can be quite a challenge to find official documentation on the use of x-callback-url for certain iOS Apps. That's why I decided to gather all information I could find and list it in an Airtable base.
**[List of Apps with x-callback-url](https://airtable.com/shrydOqT26KkIYWnd)** *Edit: Link now directs to the full base*
Feel free to use it as a reference (add to homescreen), share around and/or respond with feedback and suggestions.
*Inspired by [Siri Shortcuts Apps](https://www.reddit.com/r/shortcuts/comments/axll6p/siri_shortcuts_applications_20_running_list_of/), a running list of Apps that supports Siri Shortcuts.*

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: m374
item.description:
Exactly! I had included it in a seperate list of Apps with unverified x-callback-url support. I’ve noticed that it’s still quite common for people to mix up URL schemes with x-callback-urls. There are also some developers / bloggers who mix these up in their own documentation or write-ups, so I get why this is confusing.

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: nello
item.description:
Thank you. No, I don’t need to call back to Drafts from Spark.

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: sylumer
item.description:
In case is helps, you can read about x-callback-url here:

x-callback-url | Interapp communication – 2 Dec 10

Home | x-callback-url

x-callback-url is a URL schema based protocol for interapp communication on iOS, iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch.

Essentially they are a way of transferring control back to a calling app, with details of any success or failure, whereas a typical URL will transfer control to an app, but not back again - that is where the callback element comes in.

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: nello
item.description:
sylumer:

Are you sure there is x-callback-url support and not just URL support?

Sorry … I don’t know the difference between “x-callback-url support” and “ URL support”; apparently I misused the term x-callback-url support.

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: sylumer
item.description:
Are you sure there is x-callback-url support and not just URL support? I’ve looked at the old cached URL scheme info from Read let and the site you link to. Both only discuss URL schemes. When I tried to modify it to an x-callback-url, Spark gives me an “Oops” error message.

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: nello
item.description:
m374:

I’ve noticed that it can be quite a challenge to find official documentation on the use of x-callback-url for certain iOS Apps.

I’m brand new to drafts.app and was looking for Spark’s x-callback-url scheme; unfortunately I couldn’t find it on your site. (Apologizes if it’s there and I overlooked it.)

However, I did find it here:

Medium – 2 Dec 21

Complete List of iOS URL Schemes for Third-Party Apps (Always-Updated)

The most exhaustive list of third-party iOS app schemes on the web

Reading time: 11 min read

Perhaps you’d like to look at this page and incorporate some of its information into your site. (No offense meant.)

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: m374
item.description:
I’m slowly working on a new update of the list.
Might move away from using Airtable and instead opt for something like Github Pages.

Ideally the list would be similar like this webpage,
although I’m still figuring out how I can build something like that.

https://www.imobie.com/m1-app-checker/

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: m374
item.description:
I’ve updated viewer permissions.
Would you be able to change the link on the x-callback-url website to:
https://airtable.com/shrydOqT26KkIYWnd

Thanks in advance

Read full topic

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.description:
Thank you! I’m working on an update and will add AnkiMobile Flashcards to the list.

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: CMx3
item.description:
Anki supports x-callback-url.

App: ‎AnkiMobile Flashcards on the App Store
URL schemes: URL Schemes - AnkiMobile Manual

anki://

Creating Anki flashcards is among my favourite things to do with Drafts.

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: m374
item.description:
Thank you so much! I think you write the best App documentation out there.
What I would like to suggest is to (at some point) deliver the data I gathered to you, formatted the right way so that you could easily update the page with a few clicks. That would save you a lot of work and I would be more than happy to spend some of my time by contributing to the page.

Read full topic
item.source: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec

item.title: List of Apps with x-callback-url spec
item.dc:creator: agiletortoise
item.description:
Nicely done. I’ve been really bad at maintaining the list on the x-callback-url site, mostly updating it when a developer contacts me and asks to be added. It will be good to have a better resource. I will add a link to the apps page.

Read full topic
